website_summaries.verdict: An affordable crib liner to protect baby from getting limbs stuck between crib slats. Simple design and breathable material.
pros: Durable and lightweight polyester mesh that's highly breathable
Designed without any padding that will restrict airflow to the crib
Will fit most standard sized cribs
Easy to install by tying to crib slats
cons: Some users are put off that this liner offers no padding

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just put this on my daughter’s crib tonight. She’s 6 months old. I’m thankful I went back in to her room to feed her about 45 minutes after I laid her down because her leg was still through the bars of the crib but this time ABOVE the mesh bumper. Her body was contorted from trying to get out so that she was essentially sleeping with all of her weight on her neck. It was terrifying. I don’t care how many times I have to get up for her leg getting through the bars again. Needless to say I took it down immediately with trembling hands. Do not buy this product. Your baby will outgrow this stage soon enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not doctor recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this crib liner without giving it much thought because it was recommended by Moms on Call. When I was installing it, I was struck that the mesh was thicker and softer than I anticipated and the overlap between the two panels at each end created an even thicker area. So I Googled the product and found that the AAP recommends against all bumpers and liners, including mesh ones like this. The number of deaths is small, but serious injuries from catching a limb between slats is rarer still. There's no need for a product like this, so I will return it,even though it was quite well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Time and patience needed to install
customer_reviews.text: The website states you cannot use this on a crib with a changing table. For the record, you can if you have the time and patience to apply it. This took me a while to install to get it in a position where it looked decent. See attached pictures. Would I buy it again? Maybe if I had a regular 4 slated crib. After the time it took to apply, I will not be taking this off my crib any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy I made this purchase. After constantly hearing battling information on whether to put a crib liner in baby's crib I decided to go with this mesh one and glad I did, he has moved himself into the edge at 6 weeks and I'm certain his little legs would have been hanging through the crib slats by now, he's a mover, and I don't have to worry if his face gets too near it to suffocate himself. Truly worth the purchase, forgo the cutesy quilted things that come with some crib sets, this is by far the safer product and they don't care about cutesy, at this stage they can't see it anyway. :-)
customer_reviews.author: lcj

customer_reviews.title: Safest “bumper” out there!
customer_reviews.text: I panicked one night when our newborn son had his foot stuck in between the crib slats. After a lot of research, this seemed like the safest product. It took 10 minutes max to tie it on. He’s 6 months now and rolls around. This product is breathable if he gets his face against it and it protects his little arms and legs from getting stuck again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Peace of Mind Factor
customer_reviews.text: We originally had a bumper that was purchased with the crib from a national retailer. After reading countless warnings regarding about how bad bumpers can be., immediately purchased this mesh liner. Let me first go into how easy it is to install. Lines up perfectly and the ties have enough fabric to tie. I can’t express how important that is. We will feel better knowing he has this mesh liner than a bulky cutesy bumper.
customer_reviews.author: R. P.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cribs
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter needed to be transitioned from her pack and play to her regular crib, with something to prevent her from getting arms and legs stuck between the slats. My daughter did not have crib bumpers because of suffocation danger. The baby loved to scoot into the corner and sleep up against the mesh. This product was perfect for her crib, easy to install, and is breathable, so safe for baby. The only drawback is that they cannot see through the mesh to check on baby via the nanny cam. They will have to install a higher shelf so they can have good visibility. This is a doable option.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Crain

customer_reviews.title: Got it to work on crib with changing table attached
customer_reviews.text: Description and other reviewers have said this does not work on cribs that have a solid side or changing table attached but I got mine to work without any issues. I didn’t fully wrap the pieces on the crib like the description said, but I just took the extra fabric not needed and wrapped it back around the slats the other way until it was tight. It only leaves the space open at the very end where the changing table connects, but he is rarely down that far in the crib anyway. This at least covers where he has been getting hands and legs stuck. Worked out fine for us.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay in place
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when our LO was 4months and we transitioned to crib and would constantly get arms or legs stuck in the cribs slats. This was recommended for us as it's breathable (which is awesome). However, if you have a baby that kicks, this is NOT for you. He pulls down the netting and gets his legs stuck up high, we to the netting so he can't and he proceeds to pull them up and gets legs stuck. Thankfully it's not every night I have to free him so he can go back to sleep but it's rather frustrating. And yes, I have it on correctly, tight and tied.
customer_reviews.author: Hansen House

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work on cribs with two solid sides
customer_reviews.text: The product description led me to believe this would work on a crib with two solid sides. It doesn’t. I tried every configuration imaginable, and the liner still sagged, which is unsafe for baby. I emailed the company asking for instructions, and never heard back.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Read below.
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for my son that loves to stick his legs threw the bars of his crib. He would lay against it at night because it seemed cooler at night with the tiny holes to bring in air to his crib. Super easy to install and to wash when your munchkin decides to chew on it. He didn’t tear it and was super durable. Only downfall I found was that my son learned to climb on top of the fabric to hold himself up and almost climb out of his crib. We then upgraded him to a big boy bed at the age of 18 months and used the netting for the bed so he doesn’t fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Abrams

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 20 month old son’s crib. He keeps getting his legs stuck in between the rails and screaming. We are tired of having to go in and dislodge him and afraid he will get seriously hurt. This product disappointed me. Our crib has a solid back so we only needed the long piece. The way it said to put on was loose and when I played around with it, it was too tight and the little bit of Velcro to hold it together kept ripping off. It’s also easy for him to push it down with his legs. So basically a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: MaryKate

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one for their baby
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my baby that is starting to roll and scoot throughout the crib. If he gets next to the liner, I don’t have to worry about his legs or arms getting caught in the crib anymore. And I know that he can breathe through this if his face gets right next to it. Definitely gives me peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Albert

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but not ideal for mini cribs
customer_reviews.text: I have a mini crib and it's not the best fit. The way you need to attach it is not ideal for smaller cribs as it's a bit loose, but it might work great for regular sized cribs. The mesh is super soft, I just wish it was more see-through so the baby could see me and I see her without having to peek over the crib. The baby keeps pushing the mesh down the way it says to tie the cute bows, but didn't work for me. Instead, I tied them from the top so it can't be pushed down (see pic)
customer_reviews.author: katz

customer_reviews.title: Im annoyed by this crib liner
customer_reviews.text: I’m super annoyed by this crib liner For one it’s not wide enough in my opinion cause when my baby puts up his feet they still go through the crib slats and every time I have to change the mattress cover the liner moves first up and when I put the mattress back than it pushed the liner down so I have to pull all over the place to keep it in place. Also my baby pushes it down very easily. The only great thing about it is that it’s actually breathable. I would not recommend this crib liner unless you have strong nerves lol
customer_reviews.author: Katarina

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing about it is that it's breathable but it is a definite headache. Probably because I didn't get the right footing. I do not suggest this product for someone that's not sure what kind of crib they have. The strings should have Ties on the top and bottom not just the top so that way it doesn't move around when you're changing the crib or the baby is just moving or hitting it. Also, the velcro attachment to the crib is a bit confusing also but I made it work and we will see how it goes with the baby sleeping in it and as she grows in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They keep falling down
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so my little one won't stick his foot out the slats while sleeping. Did it get the job done? Yes. I was hesitant to buy anything in the beginning because of all the SIDS talk but this is very breathable material so it helped put my mind at ease as well. The issue I have with it is that it doesn't stay up very well. The tied up part slips down. The baby likes to play with it too. The velcro part isn't very tight either. I would still, however, recommend this product as it did what i needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Franchesca

customer_reviews.title: Breathable and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: After having this a few weeks, I can honestly say it’s a keeper. Some items to keep baby safe just haven’t worked out. Our little ones arms and legs kept finding their way between the bars of the crib. Since bumpers are not the safest, we decided to try the mesh. Does exactly what it’s supposed to do. Helps prevent our little ones arms and legs going between the bars. It’s soft(ish), easy to instal, and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Protects against bumps
customer_reviews.text: I got this only because my baby bumps herself and head HARD on the railing and even on the side with no railing. So hard that she wakes herself up, cries or both. I managed to make this fit on all sides (even the side with no railing). It is not thick like crib bumpers, but it’s thick and soft enough to protect against bumps. I’ve seen my daughter roll and hit her head a few times with the liner on and it works! No more waking up or crying from bumping herself or her head on the sides :) :) :)
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: When my baby girl started rolling/wiggling around, she got her leg through the crib slats and scared herself silly (she was not stuck at all, just freaked herself out). My son done that sort of thing on purpose, because he thought it was funny. I got this breathable mesh crib liner to keep her from doing that again. It fit the bill. Kept her limbs in the crib, safe and snug, without worries of a regular bumper. Now that she stands and cruises and climbs, we have since taken it out, but this thing was priceless for several months!
customer_reviews.author: CFS

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended.
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. Baby was sticking his arms and legs out of the crib so I bought this crib liner. Definitely read the instructions so that you can put it on correctly. Tried to wing it the first time and it didn't work well. But now that it's on, I don't want to take it off anymore because it was a lot of work to put on. Baby's arms and legs no longer stick out, although he does like to play with the liner and pull it down.
customer_reviews.author: aduh

customer_reviews.title: Good for keeping pacifiers from falling behind crib
customer_reviews.text: I used just the long piece around the back of the crib to prevent pacifiers from falling behind the crib constantly. The product is well designed with Velcro and ties, and the instructions with illustrations were helpful. My baby kicks the band, causing it to bunch down against the mattress a little bit, but it still works well (except when she throws the pacifier over it).
customer_reviews.author: charlotte eloise

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Toddler Arms and Legs Safely Inside the Crib
customer_reviews.text: This is a great solution for keeping your child's arms and legs from getting stuck in-between the bars of their crib. It took some maneuvering to get the alignment right for our crib type, but it works as intended. We haven't had any issues with our son getting his legs or arms trapped through the openings. It does move up and down slightly, and our son likes to pull it up and down while fighting his naps; however, it hasn't come undone or moved a considerable amount. The velcro is of strong quality and durability. I also like that it is breathable. Definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: These are nice because they are a bumper that is breathable
customer_reviews.text: These are nice because they are a bumper that is breathable. If they would stop sliding down on the crib they would look fine. Like a lot of other reviews mention they dont fit all cribs. My sons crib is no exception, it doesnt fit perfectly and the ends are pretty ugly do to the Velcro pieces. In the end its still a breathable bumper which will help prevent his leg or arm getting caught in the bars if it stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: Jack V. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Received today and just put into crib. I took out a star because the back side (visible inside face of the crib) had an 8 inch grayish smear. Since I was waiting to use this product tonight, I decided to scrub it away with some shout out. It did come out but it was annoying I had to clean this. Other than that, the product looks good, can be pulled taught with the velcro, and is pretty soft. I think it will do its job.
customer_reviews.author: hl1000

customer_reviews.title: Very worth it
customer_reviews.text: So worth it. Our baby’s legs would push through the crib and get stuck so we got this and haven’t had any issues. Also the binky used to fall out of the crib at night and we’d have to search in the dark for it but now this keeps in on the crib where the baby can find it and self soothe herself back to sleep on her own. We didn’t have this for our first child and I regret that. A+
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my baby’s crib. He is 8 months now and he started rolling around and getting his legs or arms stuck in between the rails and Thai is perfect to help with that problem. It also helps his pacifier to not get thrown out of the crib when he rolls around at night. It’s great quality and breathable. I can see through it. Perfect
customer_reviews.author: Donna C.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to try and keep my baby safe from Getting stuck in between the bars. Late found out it isn’t safe at all. Would not recommend it to anyone, the crib manual even says not to put ANYTHING in the crib for it is unsafe and could cause death to a child. Wish they would ban these
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Good investment
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to do a crip bumper because my little ones always got their feet caught in between the crip bars but wanted to safe sleeping as well. It was easy to install, thank youYouTube videos, and fits great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Cudworth

customer_reviews.title: Small velcro makes it hard fo use
customer_reviews.text: likes: - When baby started getting her foot stuck out of the crib it was good to have this - Cons : The lenght of the mesh is alright but THE VELCRO is too short... it was apain to make it nicely stretched out. also baby easily pulls it down so Ibhad to adjust it almost everyday I finally gave up and removed it all togheter
customer_reviews.author: Yuls

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: My baby kept getting her legs caught in the crib bars.... then realized she could do it on purpose and we would come in the room, lol. This completely stops that and stays put! I recommend weaving it in and out of the crib a few times so they can't pull it down. Breathable so if baby smooshes face into it, they still have air.
customer_reviews.author: PublicName(lols)

customer_reviews.title: Check measurements
customer_reviews.text: I bought without measuring our crib luckily I got it to fit. It is pretty wide so it reaches the top railing from our mattress being the highest level. This is pretty thick mesh, like you cant see through it unless you get really close. Our bars on the crib were wide so I'm glad I found this alternative. It velcrows on each end so that's not the most easy assembly as in I had to stretch it hard to get it to stay.
customer_reviews.author: Adonas Cary

customer_reviews.title: Crib Liners
customer_reviews.text: We had to get these for our 6 month old because she moves so much at night and was always getting her legs stuck between the bars of her crib. These keep her legs out of the bars and are breathable so even if she presses her face against them she can still breathe. I only wish they had ties on the top and bottom of the liner because i feel like it would help it slip less.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My little one kept getting her legs caught between the crib slats. I was genuinely concerned about her getting injured this way. However- I also understand there are concerns with suffocation when using traditional crib bumpers. This solved all my problems! Soft, breathable mesh keeps her limbs inside the crib without worry. It actually looks better than I thought it would and was very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so that my daughter would quit sticking her legs & arms through the crib. It definitely helps keep her in the crib, but when she wakes up, she always stands in the crib and can pull the liner down. I've tried to tighten the liner, but it never stays put. She always manages to pull it down.
customer_reviews.author: BrittCan

customer_reviews.title: I feel safer!
customer_reviews.text: So look, my wife is really concerned about SIDS. She didn't want bumpers on the crib because SIDS can get you from the side as easily as from below. So these are a perfect solution. I wrapped little Maya's head several times and after an hour she was still breathing normally. Most people would have just installed these without doing due diligence. If you know anything about me is I leave nothing to chance.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not great for IKEA crib
customer_reviews.text: Not for use with cribs that are not fully slatted all-around. I have an IKEA Sundvik crib and I couldn't wrap the liner as instructed because the sides of the crib are one solid piece of wood. However, I improvised and got it to work, somewhat. The mesh liner itself is sturdy, covers the entire slats (from mattress to top), and my baby no longer gets her little legs stuck in between them.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny A.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We love this product! Originally purchased bc our baby would stick her hands and feet outside of the crib and made us nervous. We’ve had the mesh bummer for 6 months and still love it! Installation was a little tricky at first but a breeze now! I would say it can fit pretty much any crib new and old. Our crib is 14 yrs old and fits well.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Great crib liner
customer_reviews.text: I like that the material is thick and sturdy, yet breathable. We've had this for 2 weeks and it has stayed in place very well so far. Two complaints 1) The velcro strips are not barely long enough to keep tight and secure for my daughter's crib. 2) There should be an option for just back solid crib with a lower price. They come in 2 panels and for back solid crib you only use one. But overall I am happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: OregonGrown

customer_reviews.title: Annoying to put on
customer_reviews.text: While I really love these mesh crib liners, they are really annoying to put on. If your crib doesn't have the same size slats all the way around, they may not fit right. I do need them, because my kid keeps putting his feet through the slats getting them stuck, so I will continue to use them, but I hate them every time I wash them and have to put them back on.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable, comfortable, great design!
customer_reviews.text: I’m really impressed with this bumper! I have five children and have always had traditional padded ones. This one was a bit different to put on, but the instructions made it easy to install, and the Velcro closure makes it adjustable to fit different sizes. It also comes in two pieces, so if your crib has a solid back, you can still safely use it. This was an issue we had with our old crib in the past, and I was really impressed with this design option! I washed and dried it right out of the package and it’s very soft and comfortable. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: jeshichan

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! The only thing that I don’t like is that as baby gets older he’s able to pull it down. The ties hold the mesh to the crib okay, but after a certain point, they only do so much. But it gave me peace of mind when he was little. Easy to wash, and we machine dried it. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: K J

customer_reviews.title: Falls down and doesn’t fit standard crib
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to put on and slides down on the crib. There is only one tie on the top or you could say the bottom of the item. When my little one is fussy it is super easy to pull up and down vertically. Also when installed doesn’t fit a standard crib (unless mine isn’t standard) there is an overlap when installed. Very breathable and suits the purpose but isn’t that soft.
customer_reviews.author: Satya N.

customer_reviews.title: Good for wrangling runaway pacifiers
customer_reviews.text: I did not purchase this to use in my child’s crib until after the age of 1 due to risk of SIDS. My main motivation was really due to annoyance about the daily task of retrieving a bucket’s worth of pacifiers in the morning after my kid kicks them out in the middle of the night. This is able to catch them about 90% of the time and I am really glad I installed this around the crib. The liner is not as thin as it seemed to be in the picture, but it’s fine for me due to my needs. It’s easy to install and does need occasional readjusting to keep from bunching.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor H

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: This arrived very quickly in the mail and is easy to install. It does slip down overnight, but we just readjust it the next day. It is very breathable and I have no concerns when I put our little one down for bed. She likes the feel of it too and now there's no chance of her getting her cute little limbs stuck between the crib bars. I would recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: MRS

customer_reviews.title: NOPE, THESE ARE UNSAFE - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND NO CRIB BEDDING AT ALL, SORRY WE BOUGHT THESE AND IMMEDIATELY REMOVED ONCE WE FOUND OUT THEY WERE UNSAFE.
customer_reviews.author: Amber King Camp

customer_reviews.title: Cute, great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: This is great quality for a great price. Super cute on the crib. My daughter was sticking her feet in the gaps in the crib so I bought this and ever since she’s had no issues. She loves to touch it when she’s waking up. Love that it’s breathable. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for our child. She was still able to get her limbs caught in the crib rails. Better nothing than this bumper.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Decent.
customer_reviews.text: I with it was easier to put together. And once you meet both ends with each other, they don't Velcro where you need them to. I am pretty bummed considering it wasn't cheap. But it gets the job done I am just constantly revelcroing it every evening before bed.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Breining

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but a little short for my baby
customer_reviews.text: I was worried it’d look tacky but it’s actually cute with the little bow ties to secure on the outside. The only problem I have is that my 4 month old wiggles A LOT in her sleep and throws her feet up, so sometimes she’ll end up with a foot caught over it, so if it were a little taller it’d be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: These do not work well with our crib. They are awkward trying to stay and a pain because you have to continually readjust and tighten them. There’s Velcro to help keep them tight but because of our Graco crib it doesn’t really fit well. We have a convertible crib that will turn into a full size bed. I don’t really like these. I bought them so my daughter wouldn’t get her legs stuck when she’s moving around inside. But she can still get her limbs stuck while this is on. Plus, like I said, they are flimsy after putting them on. I wouldn’t buy again or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this once my daughter started flopping all about her crib like a fish at night and her little arm or leg would get stuck through the bars. It works wonderfully and I don't have to worry about padding being a suffocation hazard. It also keeps her binky from falling through the bars at night! The mint green was perfect and matched her room decor exactly.
customer_reviews.author: April McGehee Azbill

customer_reviews.title: Great product, confusing set-up
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great and I love the breathability of it. That helps me sleep at night knowing my baby's feet are safe from sticking out (she sure loves to stick them through the bars) and she's safe from something obstructing her breathing. Overall great product! The only thing is that it is quite confusing to set up. The picture isn't very helpful and we couldn't for the life of us figure out how to make it so there wasn't a gap on one of the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I got this! I know they say crib bumpers are bad but honestly I feel this is safe. It definitely is protecting my daughters little limbs from getting stuck in her crib and it’s so thin and breathable. Plus, ever since I put this on her crib, she’s been falling asleep right away every night. I think it makes her feel more comfy and safe. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Proctor

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy until you wash it.
customer_reviews.text: It seems nice and sturdy once I took it out of the package. Unfortunately, once it’s washed it seems flimsy. I placed it on the crib and regardless of how right I make the strings it just slides down. It’s also rather short, so it doesn’t cover a great part of the railings.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! My only complaint is that we have a standard crib with a solid back, and the longer piece designed for standard cribs still isn't quite long enough. We needed like 4 more inches. So I had to use both pieces just to cover the total of 3 sides. But it does its job well and my son can no longer shove limbs through the bars!
customer_reviews.author: Emuhleigh

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: These were exactly what we needed. I didn't have these when we first started sleep training and had to rush up to our baby boy who managed to get his leg kind of stuck between the crib slat. Since installing these, I knew he won't do that. Also is great at keeping pacifiers in the crib! The amount of pacifiers that we found lodged between the wall and crib before these was pretty comical
customer_reviews.author: Dan Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bumper!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful bumper. I have a nursery with green and tan tones and this crib liner goes perfectly. It was easy to install and stays on well. I have a ChildCraft Redmond crib and it's a perfect fit! It has 2 layers... a breathable mesh layer, and a lightweight fabric layer. Both are breathable and provide some barrier to head bonks, but we mainly purchased this to prevent our little guy from getting his arms/legs stuck between the slats.
customer_reviews.author: Trillium03

customer_reviews.title: Bumper without the risk of SIDS
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for those that don't want the risk of bulky bumpers in cribs but want to avoid any limbs getting caught in the slats. We originally avoided putting any bumpers on my daughters crib but now that she is 9 months old and more active in her sleep we found that she would wake at least once a night with an arm stuck outside of the crib and unable to get it back in. We purchased this and it is great. If you follow the directions while putting it on it will be snug and not sag and will create a firm but breathable barrier for the crib.
customer_reviews.author: A. B.

customer_reviews.title: Soft but stays up - perfect bright white liner
customer_reviews.text: I've had two different crib liners and I like this one the best. It has a bit of breathable padding that both adds some softness when my son kicks it and provides a bit of rigidity to keep the liner from slipping down (like my other one does annoyingly). Wish I had two of these! Easy to install. Bright white.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Breathable and does the job
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old baby was having so many issues sticking his legs and/or arms out of the crib slates and then attempting to turn causing him to wake up in the night. This product has solved ALL our issues with that. It's also very breathable. I wrapped the material around my entire face and was still able to breath, which was really important for me to be comfortable to put this in my babies crib.
customer_reviews.author: Megan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth on whether or not I should put a bumper in my son's crib. I know they can be dangerous, but I was also afraid that my son was going to seriously hurt himself from getting a limb stuck in the crib. This bumper took care of both my concerns. Very breathable material and he hasn't had any issues getting caught since I installed it. Took a little while to set up, but was worth it in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Coleen M. Lennon

customer_reviews.title: Refreshing and Worry free solution!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and safe for infants. My son loved his mesh liner. We moved to a different type of bed (not a crib) so it didn’t fit but we used a previous one for his crib for a while. Such a refreshing and worry free solution.
customer_reviews.author: beck767

customer_reviews.title: Love these bumpers
customer_reviews.text: Love these bumpers! My son is an older infant and crawling, and he was getting bruises on his arms and legs when they would get caught in the bars on his crib. I wanted a safe breathable mesh alternative to the old type of crib bumper that can pose a suffocation risk. This was the perfect solution! I would not recommend this bumper for young infants who cannot rollover or move on their own yet. But once you have a cruiser, I see no danger in a breathable mesh bumper.
customer_reviews.author: Brig B.

customer_reviews.title: Easier than it seems
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old daughter just started sleeping in her crib and she’d move her feet near the rails when she’d wake up. I knew I needed to get a liner immediately. I opted for this one and I was not disappointed. I love the bright white color, that you are able to machine wash and dry, and that it actually works! It is nice and snug for baby not to be able to put limbs through crib rails. Don’t let the two pieces and instructions fool you. It seemed difficult to install but after looking at some pictures, it was quite easy to put all together.
customer_reviews.author: Eva’s Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Feels much safer
customer_reviews.text: My son is six months old and is always moving his little legs and arms keep getting caught in his ceib. Traditional bumpers and dangerous but I knew I needed to find something to stop him from braking his legs. I found this and I was so excited. First thing I did was press my face aginst it folded and I could breath easy! The only downside would be that it doesn't come in different sizes. My son's crib doesn't have rails all the way around but is safe to double over! This is the first night we are using it will definitely update!
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the limbs inside at all times
customer_reviews.text: This product is handy and does its job of keeping my baby from getting her legs stuck between the crib posts. However, my baby is nuts and pulls the fabric down constantly, but I think that is more of a user error and not a product error. If my baby doesn't pull on it, then it stays up.
customer_reviews.author: Muttley

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this! When we moved our little one from the bassinet to the crib, she was rolling all over the place and consistantly getting an arm or leg stuck between the slates. This did the trick and now she happily plays and sleeps in the crib.
customer_reviews.author: Random

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to heavy bumpers, could be improved
customer_reviews.text: This fits out crib very nice. It gives us a piece of mind to know our baby's limbs are protected from getting stuck in the crib. I do feel that this product could be improved somehow. It doesn't stay up completely on our crib, so my child is easy able to put her legs above it to bring it down. I feel like we are constantly tugging it back up. I wish there was a way to tie it from the top to make it stay.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: This was useful to have when our baby would roll around the ...
customer_reviews.text: This was useful to have when our baby would roll around the crib in his sleep. The liner had just a little bit of cushion so he wouldn't bonk his head against the wooden railings. The only thing I found annoying was that it was difficult for the liner to stay up. Over time it would just slide down and we would have to adjust it again. However, I can see that if it was very firmly held up it could be used by older babies as a step to climb out of the crib. Maybe by then one should just not use the product though.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Better for rectangular cribs
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I owned this product. The first time I used it on my older daughters regular crib and it worked very well. My new baby has an oval stokke crib and it doesn’t work that great in there. It constantly slips down and needs to be adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: beatrixkiddo

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: These would be good if you don't have a toddler who jumps around the crib...which i have, so they're contantly falling down & I'm always having to fix them, because the middle areas are just tied to the rails. The ends have the velcro which is fine. They are cute & 'breathable', but just not what i had in mind!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: They tend to slide down somewhat easily but that might also be my active little lady ...
customer_reviews.text: They tend to slide down somewhat easily but that might also be my active little lady that steps on them. I wish there was rubber in the ties that would help them stay up better. Otherwise, no complaints. I love the color and it does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Neat Idea but some flaws
customer_reviews.text: I wish they hadn't skimped on velcro at end of the long panel. My crib turned out to be little short and it crosses over velcro overlap on both ends. If they had just added another 6 inches of velcro on each end, this would have be a good fit. Another part that can also be improved are the ties. I doubt that they are strong enough to keep the mesh stretched from a curious baby.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for baby
customer_reviews.text: Bought this instead of a traditional bumper for safety reasons, but didn’t want my baby’s arms and legs getting caught in between crib slats. Easy to place on crib, and although it makes changing crib sheets a little more time-consuming, I feel it’s worth it for peace of mind. Would make a good shower gift—something I didn’t think of when registering.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D'Agostino

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: My sons arms and legs would go through the crib and this prevented that, especially if he would roll. I'd recommend this. It takes up some of the space in between the tight fit in the mattress, but overall good!
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: Falls down easily
customer_reviews.text: Works okay if you check it often and readjust it but keeps slipping down the crib and ties don’t stay tied very well even if knotted. I ended up taking it off the crib because it was a nuisance and I didn’t feel very safe knowing it wasn’t always secure.
customer_reviews.author: dingus

customer_reviews.title: which made her quite unhappy and nap time pretty rough. Enter the Breathable Mesh Crib Liner
customer_reviews.text: At first, we didn't want a bumper because of the SIDS risk. At 6 months old, though, our baby started getting her legs stuck through the slats, which made her quite unhappy and nap time pretty rough. Enter the Breathable Mesh Crib Liner. This crib liner is great! The back of our crib is solid, so I didn't need a liner on that part. I didn't know until I received it that it comes in two parts. I simply stored one part and used the other on the crib and it fits perfectly. Easy to install. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Safe and looks decent
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 month old would put her little hands or legs through the crib when she was sleeping and would get stuck. I was very hesitant about putting this but it works great and no issues. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Karolina

customer_reviews.title: Great option for a safe way to prevent leg and afe entrapment.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I would have given it 5 stars except for two things, 1-the ties that tie to the crib slats are just a smidgen too short, I can't tie a bow and so I have to tie a knot, and then when I want to wash it I have to spend 10 minutes on each knot trying to get it untied...which ends up being amore extra hour of work. 2-I have to pull it back up every morning, it slowly slides down the side of the crib at night. I gave it 4 starts because my daughter's feet and legs have stopped getting stuck between the crib slats at night, so we are all sleeping better and more!
customer_reviews.author: THE Reist

customer_reviews.title: Breathable and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Love this liner! I was skeptical to put anything in my son’s crib because all doctors advise not to but I was sick of waking up at night to my son screaming because his legs and arms were stuck between the wall the crib was on and the crib. This liner keeps him inside and doesn’t restrict his breathing. I didn’t put it in his crib until he could pick his head up and turn it in his own (first time extra careful mom here), but he is fine with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and does the trick
customer_reviews.text: Only had to use the long one on our crib as the back is solid. Works well to keep baby's feet and arms from dangling out. She snuggles right up to it and I feel is poses no suffocation risk if installed properly. The white is very white so against my "white" crib it almost looks blue. Thats not my favorite but better than matching bumpers that could suffocate babe.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Wigner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on and not super see through so you can easily be in the room and get by your little one. Yet very breathable and I have zero worries since the moment we put t on the crib. Has kept him from throwing/kicking his limbs outside of his crib and trapped binkies from falling which have allowed him to grab them himself. Win win
customer_reviews.author: Shea Powell

customer_reviews.title: Prevent legs from getting stuck!
customer_reviews.text: We needed something for our daughter in her crib because her legs kept getting stuck. This worked perfect and I love the teal/aqua color! So pretty! It was easy to wash and install. Great choice!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Day

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I discovered this product at our local Target, however amazon was cheaper. Product is good quality and soft and meshed for breathability, and helps secure the crib better for infants, therefore no arms and legs can stick out while the baby is asleep and moving.
customer_reviews.author: leesreviews

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: Daughter learned to roll and kept getting her arm stuck in the crib rails, thought she would get hurt so I went looking for something safe to have in the crib that would solve this problem. these are it! Easier to put on, cute, and now she feels the mesh with her hand and puts herself to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Duqrn87

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Our little one (5 months at the time of purchase) would wake up with limbs sticking through the spaces on the crib slats. With bumpers being cautioned against, we wanted to look for something that would solve the problem and not pose a health hazard; I believe we found it with the breathable liner. It is fairly simple to install, and it is definitely breathable. My wife was instantly able to sleep better, and we would recommend the product to anyone looking for a safe way to "contain" their baby.
customer_reviews.author: BRMGolf3891

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: This works well for keeping feet and pacifiers inside the crib. My daughter sometimes uses it as a foot rest though, but I don't have to worry about her getting her arm or leg stuck and trying to roll over. It's also breathable and she can breathe just fine when she lays right against the side. It does take some time to put on correctly. You have to make sure to pull right enough and tie the pieces around the rails very tight, or else it'll slide right down.
customer_reviews.author: Elva

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Took awhile to finally put on crib evenly but worth it. My baby is starting to move to the front of his crib & sometimes put his hands through so I got this before gets bigger to prevent his hands or legs getting stuck. The material is light and breathable too
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Mercado

customer_reviews.title: What’s the point?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help keep my then 7 month old daughter from sticking her limbs out of the crib. Instead, she spent any awake time in the crib teaching herself how to pull it down and later how to untie it. Didn’t quite work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Modern/contemporary and safe crib bumper.
customer_reviews.text: It was a little tricky to install, but works prefects for our crib. Is not easily removed by the child, which is great. The reason for purchasing was so our child wouldn’t stick their leg and arm through the crib slates.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: and the crib liner is still in great shape. As first time parents
customer_reviews.text: Our baby is now 2 years old, and the crib liner is still in great shape. As first time parents, we kept ourselves up at night before our child came reading horror stories about babies who had limbs caught in cribs that didn't have happy endings. We haven't had any such experiences in the last two years, and the fact that the liner is mesh means that I don't get too nervous if baby ends up falling asleep facing the liner. The color matches the sheets, and is cosmetically pleasing. Doesn't detract from nursery decor, and serves a very important purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Pangea Starlight

customer_reviews.title: Weird fit, frustrating installation
customer_reviews.text: What a pain in the butt to install. Even after watching he installation video multiple times... there’s a lot of awkward overlapping and it’s just not a good fit. We bought the correct size, so not sure what the problem is.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Safe, snuggly and soft
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I’d like a mesh bumper after using a fully padded one but I love this product! It is soft, super cute and I feel like it’s a very safe product. I put my face up to it and it was very easy to breathe through. The best part is my daughter snuggles up to it just like she would with a fully padded bumper. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: KikiShopper!

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!! It gave me peace of mind after ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic!! It gave me peace of mind after dealing with my daughter's limbs constantly poking out of her crib. I'm not entirely fond of her need to try and cuddle with this lining, but at least I don't have to worry about her suffocating. The liner does bow and puff out if you don't have it properly aligned with the mattress. It is also a real pain to install correctly. You'll have to constantly rearrange it/etc if your child pokes at it or tries to use it to pull themselves up. These are small cons considering the peace of mind you get in return!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Francis

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good!
customer_reviews.text: Like this and it serves its purpose for us of keeping pacifiers from escaping the crib. Only complain is that it sags and we need to pull in back up and tighten relatively frequently.
customer_reviews.author: D. Enderlein

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: At first he was curious and pulling on the sides but now i he's over it and they 100% make me feel at ease that his legs wont slip through at night, then a sudden movement cause a break! I see him roll and his legs rest on these and then slide down. Its great.
customer_reviews.author: ZT

customer_reviews.title: This is not like a crib bumper - it is thin
customer_reviews.text: My baby kept shoving legs and arms out between the slats on her crib which made her cry and me worry. This does the job of keeping her limbs safe. I wove it between the slats to keep the fabric from posing an extra risk. This is not like a crib bumper - it is thin, you can almost see through it, and one can easily breathe with this pressed up against the face (I tried!). I would not have added this to her crib prior to 5 mos. of age, however.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I almost sent this back
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to prevent my LO's pacifiers from falling out of her crib during the night; but standard bumpers are really ugly, conspicuous, and a potential safety hazard. So when I came across this, I was slightly relieved. And then I opened the package and tried to set it up. It was really awkward because the strips are so long and my particular crib is unlike any of the cribs these were designed for. Fortunately, I was able to problem solve and make it so that the net was taut and just high enough that it prevents the pacifiers from falling out. It achieved both form and function which makes me a very happy momma.
customer_reviews.author: avantARL

customer_reviews.title: So glad I got these!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect on our IKEA Sniglar crib. Our baby rolls around a lot and I was worried about him bumping his head or getting his limbs stuck. I am a super paranoid mom and I feel comfortable with his safety with these as I can breathe through them. Seems no different than the sides of his pack and play in that regard. Really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Doug/Emily

product_meta.title: BreathableBaby Classic Breathable Mesh Crib Liner - White
product_meta.description:
Color:WhiteOur Breathable Mesh Crib Liner is the first and the best. Unlike padded crib bumpers, our liner keeps your little one’s limbs safely inside the crib without the risk of restricted airflow. It is made of lightweight, breathe-through mesh and has been endorsed by doctors. Our liners come in solids, prints and patterns, and fit a variety of crib styles and sizes.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Recommended and Tested by Leading Pediatricians The Award-Winning, Patented, BreathableBaby Breathable Mesh Liner reduces the risks of suffocation, entanglement and climbing. Made with exclusive fabric with A.C.T. Air Channel Technology that promotes airflow and helps maintain air access. Soft and padded, keeps little limbs safely inside the crib. Hypoallergenic. Machine washable and fast drying. Adjustable to fit Standard 4-sided Slatted Cribs, Solid Back, Solid Front, and Solid-End Cribs. Solid colors coordinate with any bedding set. Satin trim finish. Soft and padded, keeps little limbs safely inside. Contains one short panel for front railing and one long panel for wrapping other 3 sides of the crib, both 11" high. Easy-wrap design; adjustable to fit cribs with slatted ends. Attaches easily with textured fasteners, no dangerous ties. Collapses to impede climbing. Safety evaluated. Tucks below mattress for extra protection. Machine washable, fast drying. Portable and durable. Hypoallergenic, poly mesh fabric. Patented. Recommended Age: Birth - 3 years.
feature_bullets: TRUSTED: The original, patented mesh crib liner with millions sold since 2002

HELPS PREVENT ENTRAPMENT: Helps prevent arms and legs from getting stuck between crib slats. Easy Care: Secure all fabric fasteners before laundering to avoid snagging. Wash separately or with like colors. Only non-chlorine bleach when needed. Tumble dry low
BREATHABLE MESH: Made of lightweight, breathe-through mesh without any padding to restrict airflow
A.C.T. AIR CHANNEL TECHNOLOGY: Thin, layered construction allows for maximum airflow
SAFETY IS #1: Independently tested for safety, our top priority
ENDORSED BY DOCTORS: Designed so baby can easily breathe through it to promote safe sleep
TOXIN FREE: 100% polyester, contains no harmful chemicals, flame retardants or formaldehyde
EASY TO INSTALL: Smartly adjusts to fit four-sided slatted and solid-back cribs
SUGGESTED AGE: For babies up to 12 months of age
INCLUDES: 1 long panel (11”H x 111” L) and 1 short panel (11” H x 82” L)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,999 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
